%description %description
Udev is an implementation of devfs/devfsd in userspace using sysfs and Udev is an implementation of devfs/devfsd in userspace using sysfs and
/sbin/hotplug. It requires a 2.6 kernel to run properly. /sbin/hotplug. It requires a 2.6 kernel to run properly.
Like devfs, udev dynamically creates and removes device nodes from /dev/. Like devfs, udev dynamically creates and removes device nodes from /dev/.
It responds to /sbin/hotplug device events. It responds to /sbin/hotplug device events.

* Sun Apr 17 2011 Anssi Hannula <anssi@mandriva.org> 165-5
+ Revision: 654180
- Use display_driver_helper to load display drivers. It checks the
drivers it knows so that the X.org configuration is appropriate for
the driver before loading it. I.e. if "vesa" is enabled, no display
drivers are loaded, and if "fglrx" is enabled "radeon" is not loaded,
and vice versa, etc. Also, no wrong version dkms binary driver is
loaded if the correct dkms source driver is going to be built later
during this boot.
- When in initrd, instead of using display_driver_helper, instead check
for the nokmsboot and failsafe boot parameters, and load drivers if
neither is set (note: initrds do not contain proprietary drivers).

+ Revision: 131555
- add a comment about video group being overidden by pam_console
- do not mark udev rules as config files
- rename rules file as 50-udev-mandriva.rules
- remove /dev/md/* and /dev/cloop/* compatibility symlinks
- use ATTR{media} instead of "cat /proc/ide/*/media" in rules
- remove /etc/udev/scripts
- update workaround for Iomega Zip from Debian rules and drop ide-model.sh
script
- remove old workarounds for USB ZIP/JAZ (now in HAL)
- remove floppy-extra-devs.sh script and rule, upstream uses a create_flopp
y_devices helper instead
- do not set explicitely dri/card* names, already upstream
- remove rules assigning "disk" group, all devices from the "block" subsyst
em get it by default (but the "disk" group gets read-only access)
- remove broken IDE rule that used to run a devfs script
- remove /dev/console rule, it's upstream and the group is of no use since
the perms are 600 (perms are handled by pam_console anyway)
- remove ircomm rule (note: upstream uses the "uucp" group, instead of "tty
")
- remove rules for tty* (already upstream)
- factorize tape rules (and add a new One for SCSI tapes)
- remove /dev/usb/tts compatibility symlinks
- remove useless NAME= assignments
- restore coldplug blacklist for STORAGE and DISPLAY PCI classes
- remove modalias hotplug rules, upstream 80-drivers hotplugs everything
- remove devfs compatibility symlinks in /dev/misc/
- remove perms for /dev/rtc, already upstream
- remove inotify rule, the inotify device has been dropped a long time ago
- remove devfs compatibility /dev/i2c/ symlinks
- remove nvidia and fb (graphics subsys) permissions assignement, Suse perm
issions rules already do that
- remove lp rules, already upstream (still drop /dev/printers/ and /dev/par
* symlinks)
- remove SCSI hotplug rules, since proper modaliases are available as of 2.
6.21 kernel
- remove input rules, most are upstream (still drop /dev/psmouse, /dev/usbm
ouse, /dev/js)
- remove firewire rules, already in upstream rules
- remove video symlinks that are already in upstream rules, and remove /dev
/vtx symlink
- remove lirc rules, they are in the lirc package
- add md-raid symlinks rules (from upstream)
- use upstream rules for device mapper
- use upstream rules for sound devices names and symlinks
- remove duplicate "audio" group assignement, now in a general subsystem ru
le
- set "audio" group for all devices from "snd" subsystem (OSS)
- remove /proc/bus/usb mount, this is done in rc.sysinit
- remove usbmouse/usbhid workaround, usbmouse now requires usbhid, which sh
ould fix the problem for Microsoft mice
- use redhat rules file for pam_console
- remove devfs-compatibility symlinks in /dev/v4l
- move cdrom_id call in 62-create_persistent.rules
- remove /dev/bus/usb rule, already in upstream rules
- remove DVB rules, already in upstream rules
- remove sg modprobe rule, already in upstream rule
- remove firmware.sh rule, already in upstream rule
- remove aoe rules (not in Gentoo rules anymore)
- remove dvb script, was for kernels <= 2.6.8
- use Suse rules to set video group when possible
- remove em8300 symlinks in /dev/video (should be in em8300 package if need
ed)
- remove futile rules for SCSI devices
- remove old usb devices rules from Gentoo and cpad rule
- remove pktcdvd/diskonkey/rem_ide/kbd/sonypi rules (not in Gentoo rules an
ymore)
- remove infiniband devices rules (not in Gentoo rules anymore)

dev/vcc symlinks)
